title: **Healthy** throughout life
key_fact_text: People in Germany are living three months longer every year.

title: Good **work** and equitable participation
key_fact_text: Today 4 million more people have jobs than they did shortly after Germanyâ€™s reunification.

title: Equal **educational opportunities** for all
key_fact_text: Despite measurable progress, every sixth young person with an immigrant background leaves school too early.

title: Having **time** for family and work
key_fact_text: The rate of those in part-time work is approximately 70% for working mothers with minor children, but is only 6% for working fathers.

title: A secure **income**
key_fact_text: Germany ranks 13 of 31 OECD countries in terms of income inequality.

title: Living a life in **security** and **freedom**
key_fact_text: Violent crime dropped by about 17% between 2007 and 2015.

title: **At home** in urban and rural areas
key_fact_text: Nearly a third of people in Germany need more than half an hour to reach the nearest large city by public transport. When travelling by car this rate is only 1%.

title: **Standing together** in family and society
key_fact_text: One in four Germans is involved in volunteer work. This represents a 28% increase from 1999.

title: Strengthening the **economy**, investing in the **future**
key_fact_text: Economic performance per capita has increased 34% since 1991.

title: Preserving **nature**, protecting the **environment**
key_fact_text: Energy consumption has dropped by some 9% since 1991.

title: Living **freely** and **equal before the law**
key_fact_text: Voter turnout for Bundestag elections was more than 90% in the 1970s. The most recent voter turnout was just over 70%.

title: Acting with global **responsibility** and securing **peace**
key_fact_text: Annual global greenhouse gas emissions have increased by around a third since 1990.
